text: Bronze man and centaur is an 8th century BCE bronze sculpture. It is in the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. == Early history and creation == Created in Greece during the mid-8th century B.C., the sculpture is made out of bronze. == Later history and display == The sculpture was a posthumous gift of J. Pierpont Morgan given to the Metropolitan Museum in 1917. == Description == The work depicts a man and centaur embracing. The bottom of the sculpture contains a geometric pattern. == References == Category:Created via preloaddraft Category:Sculptures of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Category:Sculptures of Greco-Roman mythology Category:Archaic Greek sculptures Category:Centaurs
title: Bronze man and centaur (Metropolitan Museum of Art)
